trans-unit.source: Get Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Get Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Data Source</languageKeyword> operation gets the data source definition from Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Data Source</languageKeyword> operation gets the data source definition from Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>api-key</languageKeyword> must be an admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>api-key</languageKeyword> must be an admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: Refer to the authentication section in <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> to learn more about keys.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the authentication section in <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> to learn more about keys.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> explains how to get the service URL and key properties used in the request.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> explains how to get the service URL and key properties used in the request.

trans-unit.source: Status Code: 200 OK is returned for a successful response.
trans-unit.target: Status Code: 200 OK is returned for a successful response.

trans-unit.source: The response is similar to examples in <link xlink:href="1c9399cf-e3f6-466f-8a00-73ea27ca18f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Data Source (Azure Search REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: The response is similar to examples in <link xlink:href="1c9399cf-e3f6-466f-8a00-73ea27ca18f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Data Source (Azure Search REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: Do not set the <codeInline>Accept</codeInline> request header to <codeInline>application/json;odata.metadata=none</codeInline> when calling this API as doing so will cause <codeInline>@odata.type</codeInline> attribute to be omitted from the response and you won't be able to differentiate between data change and data deletion detection policies of different types.
trans-unit.target: Do not set the <codeInline>Accept</codeInline> request header to <codeInline>application/json;odata.metadata=none</codeInline> when calling this API as doing so will cause <codeInline>@odata.type</codeInline> attribute to be omitted from the response and you won't be able to differentiate between data change and data deletion detection policies of different types.
